intro: Dryandra fraseri var. effusa, commonly known as the Geraldton waxplant, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking, waxy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. However, it is also considered a threatened species due to habitat loss and land clearing.
